item.title: Report X-2023060065
item.description:
Report X-2023060065

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T09:09:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UPON INSPECTION OF TWO WET BOXES, RESPONDER DISCOVERED THESE TO BE UNDECLARED DRY ICE PACKAGES WITH CONDENSATION FORMING ON THE OUTSIDE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING PLANT BASED BURGERS. INNER FLAPS OF THE BOXES HAVE A RED STICKER MARKED PLANTA, CAUTION - DRY ICE - AVOID CONTACT WITH SKIN AND EYES. THESE MARKINGS WERE FOLDED INCORRECTLY SO THEY WERE ONLY VISIBLE WHEN THE BOXES WERE OPENED. THERE WERE NO VISIBLE DRY ICE MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THERE ARE VISIBLE RED STICKERS STATING PLANTA PERISHABLE AND REFRIGERATE UPON ARRIVAL. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1Z25E9F10193762614.

item.title: Report E-2023060018
item.description:
Report E-2023060018

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T09:09:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-12
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 12, 2023, one (1) 300-gallon tote of hypochlorite solution had a supplier error and released approximately five (5) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the solution and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023060049
item.description:
Report X-2023060049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T09:09:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-27
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE HAZMAT AUDITORS CALLED AND SAID THEY HAD A LEAKING HAZMAT. UPON ARRIVAL IT WAS AN OXIDIZER/CORROSIVE LABELED HAZMAT THAT WAS OXYGEN BLEACH. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE OXIDIZER RESPONSE SHEET, PUT ON PPE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. RESPONDER SOLIDIFIED ALL 1.5 GALLONS USING SODIUM BICARBONATE AS ITS PH WAS 2. RESPONDER BAGGED IT INTO GREEN BAGS AND BEGAN TO ENTER IT INTO ETT. RESPONDER FOLLOWED COC AND CONTACTED BASE AND ENVIORMENTAL COORDINATOR WHO CALLED AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER TO THE SCENE. ONCE THEY ARRIVED, THEY CLEANED IT UP AND PUT IT IN A 55-GAL PLASTIC DRUM.

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY A HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION THE INNER CONTENTS WE FOUND ONE LITER BOTTLE OF TRUE TERPENES CDT GRENADINE THAT HAD A CRACKED CLOSURE. THE LEAK WAS CONTAINED WITHIN THE INNER PACKAGING BUT HAD BEGUN TO SOIL THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE HAD SUCCESSFULLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY PRIOR TO DISCOVERY.

item.title: Report E-2023050049
item.description:
Report E-2023050049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T09:09:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-01
  • City: WILLIAMSBURG
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 1, 2023, at 1650 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Williamsburg, Kentucky regarding the release of approximately 2 gallons of Acrylic Resin Solution (Resin solution, UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was reportedly due to a puncture to the drum and was contained to a 5’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents, hand tools and the proper PPE. All waste debris generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste drum was then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023050011
item.description:
Report E-2023050011

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T09:09:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-28
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 28, 2023, at 1551 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Walton, Kentucky regarding the release of approximately 20 gallons of Nitrobase WZ65 Orange (Printing ink, UN1210, 3, II) from (10) 55-gallon metal drums. The release was reportedly due to a load shift in transit and was contained to a 10’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents, hand tools and the proper PPE. The damaged drums, remaining product and all other waste debris generated were containerized in (2) 95-gallon plastic drums and (7) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste drums were then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLU experienced a UN1230 Methanol Cleanroom LP release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 10' x 10' area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, ONE PACKAGE WAS SUSPECTED TO CONTAIN DANGEROUS GOODS, BUT HAD NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKINGS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX AS REQUIRED. DESCRIPTION ON THERMAL LABEL INDICATES PRODUCT IS PROCARE DENT 30P ACID NEU. INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE 5 LITER OF MIELE PROCARE DENT 30 P MARKED AS UN1805 PHOSPHORIC ACID, SOLUTION AND LABELED WITH A CORROSIVE DIAMOND LABEL ON THE PRODUCT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

DescribePack: Cap came loose during transit due to package being loaded upside down. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Packages were put into a lined tote. 2.   • Description: RESPONDER CALLED FOR A LEAKER ON IRREG BELT 2. UPON ARRIVING, RESPONDER DETERMINED IT WAS A HAZMAT THAT WAS LEAKING. FOLLOWING THE CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL, RESPONDER REFERRED TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET, PUT ON ALL OF PPE, CONTANIRIZED THE PACKAGE, AND PUT SODIUM BICARBONATE ON THE SPILL THAT WAS ON THE FLOOR. ONCE IT GOT TO THE CORRECT PH LEVEL, RESPONDER PLACED ZEP ZORBENT ON TOP AND SWEPT IT UP. THEN TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY WE RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT ORIGIN. THE PACKAGE WAS APPROPRIATELY MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1268, PETROLEUM DISTILLATES, N.O.S. THE OUTER BOX IS UN SPECIFICATION PACKAGING. THERE IS A FLAMMABLE DIAMOND LABEL AND A COMPLETED IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION AFFIXED TO THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED 2 X 16 OUNCE BOTTLES OF MED-163 SILICONE PRIMER THAT WERE LEAKING FROM LOOSE CLOSURES. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 859278, NUSIL TECHNOLOGY, 1050 CINDY LN, CARPINTERIA CA 93013.

item.title: Report X-2023030069
item.description:
Report X-2023030069

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-01
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, A RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO INSPECT A PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DETERMINED THE INNER CONTENTS WERE NOT LEAKING. THE BOX WAS WET DUE TO CONDENSATION FORMING FROM DRY ICE THAT HAD NOT BEEN DECLARED ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE CONTAINED APPROXIMATLEY 5 KGS OF DRY ICE COOLING FROZEN BLOOD SAMPLES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM GEORGIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 8772R5, WELLNESS LABS, 7780 E 106TH ST., TULSA OK 74133. ADDITIONALLY, THE ACTUAL SHIPPER ADDRESS IN GEORGIA AS SHOWN ON THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A VALID ADDRESS IN GEORGIA. PRIOR TO DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ATL TO SDF.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-09
  • City: Hebron
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 9 Jan 2023 Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from their RT station in Hebron KY. During normal sort procedures a box was offered to the spill clean up specialist which had a stain on the side of the fibreboard box indicating a spill within. Before Further inspection, it was noted the stain on the package smelled of gasoline or some other sort of stringent cleaner. Further inspection of the package found what appeared to a machine part of some kind. The part was wrap in a plastic moisture barrier. Bubble wrap was reported used as dunnage, and PIG mats were placed on the bottom of the box. A call to the shipper from DG Admin confirmed this was a used fuel pump from an aircraft which was out for repair. The fluid was reported by the shipper as jet fuel. This package was not marked nor labeled to inform others of the dangerous good in apparatus contained in the package. Package has been held at the station pending a FAA investigation. i

INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED 4 X 4 L PLASTIC BOTTLES OF LAB ALLEY AMMONIUM HYDROXIDE 28%-30%. ONE BOTTLE HAD A HOLE ON THE SIDE AND HAD LEAKED APPROXIMATELY THREE LITERS.

item.description:
Report E-2023010272

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-17
  • City: CORBIN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 1/17/2023 at 2038 personnel in the CSXT Corbin Yard discovered GATX 94659, a loaded tank car of crude sulfate turpentine leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and Domtar and the National Response Center were notified CHEMTREC Report # 2023-01-17-00304. Marion Environmental, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a product leak coming from the liquid valve packing gland. The packing was missing two nuts that hold the packing into place. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Brain Kozlowski, 715-886-7310. Contractor personnel installed the two packing gland nuts, tightened them down, and wiped the car down. The leak was secured was held until an OTMA could be submitted. This incident did require a special switching move.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-22
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, A FULLY DECLARED LITHIUM BATTERY PACKAGE FROM HONG KONG TO USA WAS FOUND TO BE WARM TO THE TOUCH WITH A BURNT SMELL. RESPONDER FURTHER INSPECTED TO DISCOVER A SMALL AREA OF BLACK CHARRING VISIBLE ON ONE SURFACE OF THE OUTER BOX. INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS FOUND EVIDENCE OF A THERMAL EVENT HAVING OCCURRED. SOME OF THE BATTERIES WERE CHARRED AND CORRODED WITH FURTHER BLACK CHARRING ON THE INNER FLAPS OF THE BOX. THERE WERE APPROXIMATELY FIFTY INDIVIDUALLY LITHIUM BATTERIES IN CLAMSHELL TYPE PACKAGING WITH THE THERMAL EVENT APPEARING TO BE CONFINED TO A SMALL NUMBER OF THE BATTERIES. PRIOR TO DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY FLOWN ON UPS FLIGHTS FROM HKG TO ANC, ANC TO DISCOVERY AT SDF. THE LITHIUM BATTERY INCIDENT WAS REPORTED TO THE NRC UNDER NRC#1355620 AS REQUIRED PER 49CFR 171.15.

  • Description: On December 14, 2022, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN3098 were damaged due to a cargo shift and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC, who dispatched a crew from Enviroserve (ES) to complete the necessary remedial actions. ES personnel offloaded the damaged pails and utilized neutralizer and hand tools to containerize all UN3098-impacted material in one (1) 35-gallon drum and one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.description:

  • City: PADUCAH
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 13, 2022 at 1051 ET, XPO Logistics (XMA terminal) contacted ERTS regarding a UN3266, Corrosive Liquid, Basic, Inorganic, N.O.S., 8, PG III "Instant Power Heavy Duty Drain Opener" release that occurred at 1030 ET. It was advised that 2 quarts of product released from at least (2) 1-quart bottles to the dock due to forklift punctures. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pint of product released to the dock floor in a 2' x 2' area due to a puncture. The damaged box and 7 damaged bottles were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022120328
item.description:
Report E-2022120328

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-01
  • City: RACELAND
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/01/2022 at 0815, personnel in the CSXT Russell Yard discovered UTLX 67206, a loaded tank car of Xylenols liquid, emitting a strong odor from the car. The car was isolated, and the shipper, National Response Center, and Kentucky EOC were notified. (CHEMTREC Report # 2022-1201-00083). Quick Response, a CSXT approved hazardous material contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the bottom outlet valve flange inadequately secured to affect a proper seal between the valve and the bottom of the tank car resulting in a release of hazardous materials. The issue was identified, and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative, Mr. Randy Shilling, 832-783-6428. Containment was positioned under the leaking valve and attempts were made to secure the tank in accordance with 49 CFR 173.31, all released material was cleaned from the exterior of the car, and the car was placed on hazmat hold. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 not required. Cause Code:535 NARRI:60

item.title: Report X-2022120165
item.description:
Report X-2022120165

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-02
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, ACCEPTANCE AUDITOR WAS BEGINNING THE AUDIT PROCESS OF A DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1266 PERUMERY PRODUCTS WITH APPROPRIATE SHIPPING PAPERS. THE PACKAGE WAS NOTICED TO BE WET AND POSSIBLY LEAKING. AUDITOR HALTED THE AUDIT PROCESS AND A RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED TO INSPECT CONTENTS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 10 ML AND 50 ML SIZE BOTTLES OF ELECTRIC SKY TORY BURCH PERFUMERIES. THERE WAS ONE 10 ML/.3 OZ BOTTLE COMPLETELY SHATTERED, WITHOUT ANY LIQUID CONTENTS REMAINING. THE PACKAGE WAS GROUND FED DIRECTLY TO LOUISVILLE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FOUR POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING PIZZA. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING DRY ICE WAS BEING USED TO COOL THE PIZZA. OUTER BOX HAS MASSA PIZZA COMPANY MARKINGS, PERISHABLE, AND KEEP FROZEN PREPRINTED ON IT. THIS PACKAGE WAS PART OF 208 PACKAGES THAT CAME TO LOUISVILLE IN A GROUND FEEDER MOVE FROM ILLINOIS. WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO VALIDATE ONE PACKAGE WITHOUT DANGEROUS GOODS MARKINGS. PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 046733, ALAMODE FOODS, INC. / QVC, 9240 BELMONT AVE, UNIT C, FRANKLIN PARK IL 60131.

  • City: LOUISVILLE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1125 ET, XPO terminal XLU contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside a trailer located in Louisville, KY. The spill consisted of (1) 50 pound plastic bag of Master Remover Activator, which was damaged by a forklift prior to arrival at the terminal as the bag was discovered torn along the bottom, releasing approximately 5 pounds onto the floor of the trailer. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct cleanup. At 1315 ET, Hepaco arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 pounds of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor and a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor. The damaged bag and all cleanup debris were placed into a 55 gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

If a package handler had placed their hand there, they could have been burned by the corrosive material. Package as picked up carefully and placed in a red tote. The liquid did not leak out past the carboard. DescribePack: Loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Tighten lid and placed item in a thicker plastic bag,

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A DECLARED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING. PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ITALY TO USA, DISCOVERED LEAKING AT THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY. PACKAGE HAS AN IATA DECLARATION AND IS APPROPRIATELY MARKED AND LABELED UN1266 PERFUMERY PRODUCTS. THE PACKAGE PASSED A DANGEROUS GOODS ACCEPTANCE AUDIT IN ITALY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 5 X 3 LITER BOTTLES OF DR VRANJES FIRENZE FRAGRANCE WITH ONE BOTTLE LEAKING DUE TO A LOOSE CLOSURE. THE PACKAGE IS CURRENTLY BEING HELD AT SDF FOR POSSIBLE FAA INSPECTION.

  • City: LOUISVILLE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0812 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XLU) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a puncture approximately 2 gallons of Pre-Soak Plus(Hazardous - UN1760) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor at door #54. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct cleanup. At 1020 ET, Hepaco personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 gallons of product released to s 4' x 4' area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected. The damaged drum and impacted absorbents were then collected into a 95 gallon poly drum. The waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2022101108

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-05
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THIS PACKAGE WAS ORIGINALLY SHIPPED IN AUGUST FROM GREAT BRITAIN TO MIAMI, FLORIDA. SEVERAL DELIVERY ATTEMPTS WERE UNSUCCESSFUL AND PACKAGE WAS ULTIMATELY BEING RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER. UPON RETURN UNDER TRACKING 1ZW074F30488037941, THE PACKAGE PROGRESS WAS HALTED BY SECURITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY. UPON INSPECTION, RESPONDER DISCOVERED 275 LIGHTERS AND ROLLING PAPERS. INVOICE STATES CONTENTS BEING SHIPPED ARE PAPERS, SHIRTS, PANTS, BOOKS, AND SCHOOL SUPPLIES. THE BOX APPEARS TO BE REUSED WITH VARIOUS LABELS, MARKS AND HANDWRITTEN OR SCRIBBLED OUT INFORMATION. THERE ARE NO VISIBLE DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS INDICATING LIGHTERS WERE BEING SHIPPED. THERE IS ONE MADE IN CHINA SIGNAGE WITH 'STRENGTH NICOTINE' INDICATED. THERE IS NO NICOTINE INSIDE THE BOX. PACKAGE IS BEING HELD AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY FOR FAA INSPECTION.

  • Description: On 10/12/2022, at 0544, personnel in the CSXT Russell Yard discovered GATX 206288, a loaded tank car of Methanol, leaking from Manway Cover. The car was isolated and (Chemserve Terminal, NRC, KYEM were notified. CHEMTREC Report #2022-1012-0055. Quick Response, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found 5 of 8 Manway Bolts less then tool tight. The issue was identified, and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Triston Blake 316-213-4452 and Stacy Kirk 910-622-2491. Contractor personnel secured the Manway Cover. The leak was secured, and the car was released for transport. This incident did require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 212 NARRI: 5

Report X-2022100037

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-03
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE HQRP NI-MH BATTERY THAT APPEARED BLACKENED AND CORRODED AT THE TERMINALS. THE BATTERY WAS PACKAGED IN AN OUTER PLASTIC AMAZON POLYMAILER BAG. THE NI-MH BATTERY WAS ENCLOSED IN A CLEAR PLASTIC BAG INSIDE THE POLYMAILER BAG. NO ADDITIONAL INNER PACKAGING. THE THERMAL LABEL IS MARKED "NOT RESTRICTED AS PER SPECIAL PROVISION A199". HOWEVER, THE BATTERY HAS NOT BEEN PREPARED OR PACKAGED IN A MANNER TO PREVENT SHORT CIRCUIT OR DAMAGE TO THE TERMINALS PER SPECIAL PROVISION A199. NO EXTERNAL RELEASE INTO THE ENVIRONMENT. REPORTING PER 171.16. PRIOR TO DISCOVERY, THE PACKAGE WAS GROUND FED FROM MICHIGAN TO THE DISCOVERY FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER W612R6, AMAZON.COM.KYDC, INC., 1200 FEATHERSTONE RD., PONTIAC MI 48342. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, CO.

item.title: Report E-2022100021
item.description:
Report E-2022100021

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-29
  • City: RUSSELL
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 9/29/2022 at 0643, personnel in the CSXT Russell Yard discovered ETCX 21077, a loaded tank car of Propionic Acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, Kentucky EOC were notified. (CHEMTREC Report # 2022-0929-00058). Joe Taylor, a CSXT hazardous materials manager, was dispatched to the scene and found two of eight manway securement bolts inadequately secured to affect a proper seal between the manway cover and nozzle resulting in a release of hazardous materials. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative, Mr. Tony Micks 314-413-7339. The manway was secured in accordance with 49 CFR 173.31, all released material was cleaned from the exterior of the car, and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 not required. Cause Code:200 NARRI:100

item.title: Report E-2022090557
item.description:
Report E-2022090557

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-08
  • City: HOPKINSVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 8, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Wurth Brake & Parts Cleaner (contains methyl acetate) was punctured during loading and released approximately a half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environment Services (HES) to perform the necessary corrective actions. HES personnel reported that all Wurth Brake & Parts Cleaner had evaporated, then containerized the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The right front tire of the vehicle dropped off the right edge of the road. The driver saw a driveway in his path and tried to correct his steering by bringing the right tire back on the pavement. The driver over-corrected his steering and the vehicle veered sharply left resulting in the truck rolling on its top and then side coming to a rest on the drivers side. The cargo tank remained intact. The cargo tank was reinforced by Abs, some of which were damaged. No product was released from the cargo tank. The cargo tank vehicle was uprighted by a towing company which towed the vehicle to our facility to off-load the product.

DescribePack: LIDS CAME OFF DUE TO EXTREME PRESSUE AND HEAT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY PULLED VAN OUT OF BUILDING, GOT PACKAGES PUT OF VAN AND PUT DOWN NEUTRALIZER. 2.X-202281523SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS LOADED IN TRAILER WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS UPSIDE DOWN. PACKAGE WAS PUT INTO TOTE DescribePack: LIDS POPPED OFF DUE TO PRESSURE DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PUT IN TOTE

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-11
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FREIGHT FACILITY, EXPRESS FREIGHT SHIPMENT 1Z2F18E9E531597824 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF BEING RESTACKED WHEN TWO BOXES WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS WERE DISCOVERED WITHIN THE SKID. THESE BOXES WERE CONCEALED WITHIN THE SKID OF APPROXIMATELY 50 PACKAGES. THE ENTIRE FREIGHT WAS ORIGINALLY WRAPPED WITH OPAQUE PURPLE SHRINK WRAP. INSPECTED CONTENTS OF THE LIMITED QUANTITY MARKED PACKAGES CONTAIN FLAMMABLE STEM WASPS, HORNETS, AND YELLOW JACKETS AEROSOL CANS AND CORROSIVE MARINE 31 MILDEW REMOVER GEL. SHIPMENT WAS FLOWN FROM PHL TO SDF WITH AN ULTIMATE DESTINATION OF UNITED ARAB EMIRATES. THE FREIGHT WAS SHIPPED USING THE CONSIGNEE UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 2F18E9, DESERT ONLINE GENERAL TRADING, P.O. BOX 30183, DUBAI 30183, UNITED ARAB EMIRATES.

Car Foreman Chris Renfrow was empying a scrap bin and noticed the RCRX 1286 venting at 0845 hours on 7/7/2022. E3 was called and responded. E3 found loose bolts on a valve on top of the car and tightened them to stop the leak.

item.title: Report X-2022070112
item.description:
Report X-2022070112

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T21:09:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-01
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE WITH AN OBSOLETE CONSUMER COMMODITY ORM-D MARKING, 80% ALCOHOL LIQUID HAND SANITIZER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 4 X 1 GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF THE PRODUCT INSIDE THE BOX. ONE CONTAINER HAD LEAKED APPROXIMATELY HALF OF THE CONTENTS. THE SEALED FOIL WAS BROKEN ON TWO OF THE CONTAINERS AND THE CAP WAS LOOSE ON ONE CONTAINER. LEAKING CONTENTS HAVE EVAPORATED, ONLY VISIBLE SOIL LEFT ON THE THERMAL LABEL. THIS PACKAGE WAS OFFERED TO UPS AS GROUND TO ALASKA AND TRAILERED TO SDF VIA GROUND. PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER AT SDF, BUT DID NOT FLY.
